body: @drcrallen yes I can do that.
Ah, It has merge conflicts. @navis can you rebase with the latest master ?
@drcrallen Addressed all the comments. Sent #2724 and #2712 to address comments regarding plugging helpers.

@fjy looks like the name might change in the near future. Suggest either leaving as proposed until there's more stability in naming, or simply waiting on this merge for a week or two (which means it might not get to be a part of 0.9.0)
would be nice to see some additional tests too, especially tests involving null handling.
The use case for this tool would be running it on a historical node, or indexing node, or on a segment you downloaded yourself from deep storage.
:+1:  after https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2722#discussion_r57369630

This is NOT a regression in 0.9.0
Please see https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md for how to rebase and squash commits

@navis #2727 is the BoundFilter changes I was talking about, it also tightens the contract of GenericIndexed.indexOf (not Indexed, since it has a bunch of impls that do not satisfy that contract)
:+1: , after travis.

Is the point here to be able to copy the data, or just to get insight into what's going on in the segment?

If the point is to copy the data, then I could see a base64 encoding of complex metrics working well to solve that use case,

but if the point is to get insight into the segment, then for complex metrics perhaps a toString call or similar so that the complex metric can decide for itself what is important.
https://github.com/druid-io/druid-api/pull/78
@drcrallen hmm, good question. The use case I had in mind was "to get insight". it may make sense to have a flag to switch behavior, so the "copy data" folks can have something that works for them.

@xvrl @gianm I added tests for ServersResource, mainly for serialization of DruidServer. I created the test based on the previous version (with a serialization of DruidServer) so the customized serialized outputs of `getServer()` and `getClusterServers()` matches with a serialization of DruidServer which is now removed.
I propose having the scope here be limited to the "gain insight" use case and have any copy-data needs be addressed through the DatasourceInputFormat (or similar) functionality.
that sounds fair.

wait, that should be a different issue.
@gianm should we change default to use roaring as it seems to be much better in most cases
:+1: after dependency is in and travis passes.

re: equals() and hashCode(), copying a comment from earlier:

Only BoundDimFilter and SelectorDimFilter have proper equals implementations;

I had the equals() and hashcode() methods for those DimFilters throw an exception when called, and found out that AndDimFilter and OrDimFilter trigger equals() on its sub filters via this call:

```
fields.removeAll(Collections.singletonList(null));
```

But the default equals() implementation is sufficient for this null removal.

I also disabled the proper equals/hashcode methods on BoundDimFilter and SelectorDimFilter, the only problem I saw with doing that in the unit tests was in TimeseriesQueryRunnerTest, where there are some explicit equality checks on SelectorDimFilter:

```
Assert.assertEquals(
    Druids.newSelectorDimFilterBuilder()
          .dimension(QueryRunnerTestHelper.marketDimension)
          .value("upfront")
          .build(),
    query.getDimensionsFilter()
);
```

@drcrallen Do you have any suggestions for unit tests that you would like to see? 

I added a "filters with extraction functions on null column" test in my commits today, and plan to add some more tests extending the BaseFilterTest introduced by https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2727 when that's merged

I keep seeing travis failures on:

```
ERROR] /home/travis/build/druid-io/druid/processing/src/test/java/io/druid/query/filter/SelectorDimFilterTest.java:[44,43] constructor SelectorDimFilter in class io.druid.query.filter.SelectorDimFilter cannot be applied to given types;
  required: java.lang.String,java.lang.String,io.druid.query.extraction.ExtractionFn
  found: java.lang.String,java.lang.String
  reason: actual and formal argument lists differ in length
```

but I've updated that file:
https://github.com/jon-wei/druid/blob/filter_support/processing/src/test/java/io/druid/query/filter/SelectorDimFilterTest.java

and this patch passes unit tests on my local machine.

Any ideas on what's happening?
@fjy @himanshug i think all comments have been resolved.

Note that 0.9.0 also revamps how extensions are loaded. Since @mark1900 reported this as resolved, and extensions are revamped in 0.9.0, I'm marking this as close.

Please re-open if new evidence arises.

@navis AFAIC,  there are not newly added fields in a query itself which `computeCacheKey` uses to make a byte array. I think it would be better adding a flag to switch on/off the newly added functionality that is listing dimensions and metrics in a query output. Correct me if I am wrong.

@drcrallen i thought the way to go is to use dimensionSpec lookup implementation instead of having nested lookup with extraction function with dimension. But if you feel we need to support both i am fine with that as well. I will leave it to you. In case you want to support both ways i am ok please add docs.

@b-slim yes, that is the recommended way, and I will mention that in the docs. Sometimes you just need to do some testing though, or there could be things extraction functions can do that lookups cannot yet (since they are slightly different code paths).

For example, we have UI tooling to handle dimension extraction but not lookup dimension spec yet. I'll be using this to make sure transitions and upgrades go smoothly.
@drcrallen no problem, :+1: after docs.
rebased and merge conflicts
Fixed this for 0.9.0 while backporting #2698 in #2732; so no need to backport this to 0.9.0 separately.
There are no tests for things which actually have an introspection. Can you have something that gives an example on how this is intended to be used?
this change moved some lookup docs into the wrong directory.
@drcrallen Is dynamic configuration not a part of any extension?
@drcrallen this will have to be backported
Dynamic config is not an extension
@fjy well, this feature is in 0.9.1 not 0.9.0

@drcrallen okay

can we remove it from the 0.9.0 docs then?
they are not in 0.9.0: https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/0.9.0/docs/content/querying/lookups.md
@drcrallen which ones? Will you be opening up a PR to fix that or should @fjy look into it?

Dynamic Config is not an extension as it does not actually DO anything, but rather just provides a framework for getting the config around. There's the part that's in druid as of 0.9.1 https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2735
this PR is wrong, it includes lookup functionality that is not actually in 0.9.0. closing for now.
@gianm ^^^^ (forgot to tag you in the response)
@drcrallen is the namespaced lookup extension no longer suggested for use in 0.9.1, in favor of the dynamic config stuff?

@gianm that is still being developed. @sirpkt beat me to the punch on this part: https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2716 

Once #2716 is fleshed out a little more we'll know for sure. But right now there is not enough change in master to make the change in recommendation.

ok, I'm asking because this PR removes references to the namespaced-lookups extension from lookups.md. I feel like we should have some stuff on both lookups.md and the namespaced lookup extension docs that clarify the situation for readers.

I realized I hadn't written this down yet, but I'm thinking this PR might be able to be the switching point for the extension to allow the recommended lookups to go through the dynamic configuration instead of through static configs for this extension. (mentioned in https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2735#issuecomment-201380789 )

If you think such a task is too far out of scope for this PR, please let me know and we can limit the scope here to a minimal change, and have a potentially more sweeping change come later.

@drcrallen In other words: I am happy with this PR to the degree that you are happy with how lookups.md and namespaced-lookup.md make it clear to readers what the options are for cluster-wide server-side query time lookups, and what the most recommended option is.
Some of the new tests depend on #2737 to work.

@gianm changed to

> For static lookups defined in `runtime.properties` rather than embedded in the query, please look at the experimental [namespaced lookup extension](../development/extensions-core/namespaced-lookup.html).
:+1: looks good to me, thanks for catching this.
@gianm is there a unit test that can be added for such a case?

@drcrallen #2727 has some tests that do hit this case (in new test files), I didn't include them here since they were already in that one.

this is one of them: https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2727/files#diff-fcf344c7211cdbe0c45d06ec5ade158aR135
Try, try again…

Looking good!

If comment chain from https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2525#discussion_r55123901 is a blocker here, can the master comment in this PR be updated to reflect the blocking items?
Need to add an entry at https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/master/distribution/pom.xml#L92 if it's a core extension.

re: travis failures, there was a merge conflict in SelectorDimFilterTest that didn't get picked up by github for whatever reason, I rebased to fix it.
@pjain1 @drcrallen Done rebasing.
@erikdubbelboer does this approach work for you?
@navis yes, I think it doesn't need to live in java-util since this is only used by Druid itself.
:+1: after travis

I will try to reduce the size of this PR by splitting out the generic dimension interface changes, with support for only String dimensions.

Long/Float support will then be a separate follow-on PR that uses the generic dimension interface.
